history_text.reg_death: m_c poisoned {PRONOUN/m_c/self} collecting excessive amounts of tansy as an apprentice.
history_text.lead_death: after collecting excessive amounts of tansy as an apprentice

fail_outcomes.text: app1 ignores p_l as p_l launches into a story about the dangers of tansy. That's the wrong move though, because by the time {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} back at camp, nausea has well and truly set in.

history_text.reg_death: m_c poisoned {PRONOUN/m_c/self} collecting excessive amounts of tansy as an apprentice.
history_text.lead_death: after collecting excessive amounts of tansy as an apprentice

intro_text: Listen to the wisdom of the sages, p_l meows. app1 doesn't just need to learn to set bones and clean wounds; being a medicine cat is so much more than blood and bodies.
decline_text: They're interrupted by a Clanmate who needs them. It halts the lesson, but also reinforces p_l's point.

success_outcomes.text: Some sicknesses aren't physical, but live in the mind instead, p_l instructs. That's very normal, and just as a Clanmate with a twisted leg is just as loved and valued as one who can run without pain, an illness that is mental is just as valid of a struggle. Those cats are just as loved and supported in their needs.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 feels overwhelmed with the responsibility of supporting Clanmates going through mental struggles - physical fights are so much simpler to support them with. p_l halts the lesson to comfort {PRONOUN/app1/object}.
